Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Compiling C# aspnet project runs TypeScript compiler for wwwroot what is redundant and error-prone" (#2243) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I have aт aspnet core project where *.ts got deployed into wwwroot. Some of ts files are typings (from DefinetlyTyped). So very unclear reason existence that typescript files in wwwroot force dotnet/VS run TypeScript compiler. 
First of all it's completely redundant. I compile all ts files already and copied them into wwwroot with my client build tools. But moreover it can produce errors. For example if mentined typing targets a newer version of TypeScript compiler than installed globally.
In case compilation of the aspnet project fails with the following error:
Error	TS5023	Build:Unknown compiler option 'strictFunctionTypes'.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1203230/31569951-00c8e34a-b088-11e7-8547-ada309826e81.png)

I'm getting the error in VS and Rider but not in cli (`dotnet build`).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Q: How to return views from middlewares" (#2247) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I want to create a middleware such that I could return a view from it. I want to use it like `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` and `StatusCodePagesMiddleware`  but in a single entity.

I realized that `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` does something similar to what I need. But I can't understand how it works even after digging into its sources.

Here is the place where `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` returns a view - https://github.com/aspnet/Diagnostics/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics/DeveloperExceptionPage/DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware.cs#L206

But what kind of view it is? It's definitely not a razor page (as it has no `@page` directive). Also it doesn't look like a normal mvc as it has construct in `@functions`. I can't create something similar in a normal aspnetcore project. In the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics project there're two files for that view: `ErrorPage.cshtml` and `ErrorPage.Designer.cs`. How that Designer.cs file was created? It looks like a generated file. And thanks to it there's a normal class in the project (`ErrorPage`) which can be used explicitly. It inherits `Microsoft.Extensions.RazorViews.BaseView` class from `Microsoft.Extensions.RazorViews.Sources` package as I can understand.

So the middleware just executes that view:
```
var errorPage = new ErrorPage(model);
return errorPage.ExecuteAsync(context);
```
So, as the bottom line the question is how to achieve the similar logic of returning razor views from middlewares?

P.S. I hope it's appropriate that I repeated my question from [SO](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46777617) here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Q: How to return views from middlewares" (#2247) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I want to create a middleware such that I could return a view from it. I want to use it like `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` and `StatusCodePagesMiddleware`  but in a single entity.

I realized that `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` does something similar to what I need. But I can't understand how it works even after digging into its sources.

Here is the place where `DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware` returns a view - https://github.com/aspnet/Diagnostics/blob/dev/src/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics/DeveloperExceptionPage/DeveloperExceptionPageMiddleware.cs#L206

But what kind of view it is? It's definitely not a razor page (as it has no `@page` directive). Also it doesn't look like a normal mvc as it has construct in `@functions`. I can't create something similar in a normal aspnetcore project. In the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Diagnostics project there're two files for that view: `ErrorPage.cshtml` and `ErrorPage.Designer.cs`. How that Designer.cs file was created? It looks like a generated file. And thanks to it there's a normal class in the project (`ErrorPage`) which can be used explicitly. It inherits `Microsoft.Extensions.RazorViews.BaseView` class from `Microsoft.Extensions.RazorViews.Sources` package as I can understand.

So the middleware just executes that view:
```
var errorPage = new ErrorPage(model);
return errorPage.ExecuteAsync(context);
```
So, as the bottom line the question is how to achieve the similar logic of returning razor views from middlewares?

P.S. I hope it's appropriate that I repeated my question from [SO](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46777617) here.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Adding roundtripping test for CancelInvocation message" (#1031) at aspnet/SignalR
Closed issue "Client fails to connect over WebSocket" (#1022) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
I know it's very early days, but I'm trialling SignalR Core (alpha2-final) in a small setup with 3 application/web servers and the Redis scale-out package.

I can connect with WebSocket to just one server, and with SSE/Long Polling to the scale-out environment.

In the single-server environment, the client can connect with WebSocket and receives messages/invocations once.

In the scale-out with SSE or Long Polling, the client receives the same message/invocation multiple times. I assume this is due to not having sticky sessions when load balancing.

In the scale-out with WebSocket, the client fails to connect.

Here's an extract of the logs from the scale-out environment with Docker [Swarm], and with a client that attempts to reconnect if the connection fails or is broken:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Question] Solicit-Response Example " (#1029) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
One of the thing I like about SignalR is I can move to a solicit-response model and not a request-response model. I'm just starting with this and I'm looking for some approaches to try out. The case I'm working with is a tree view. The user connects through MVC and once the page is loaded I use SignalR to interact with a tree (ol). I only sent the nodes that are active as the user clicks around, based on some user preferences.

Sometimes I need to get info from the user without their interaction. When they click a node, I start processing. At some point I need to look into their browser and get information to continue. For example, there is a value in the browser that tells me how many levels of nodes to show and if I show form the root or trim to the start node. The way I have this working is I await the building of the tree while I solicit the values from the browser. Right now, I do this in two pieces. I send the solicit, which activates a JavaScript function, and this function sends the response. The problem I'm having is with getting back to the awaited task. Is there a clean way to tie the two together? Or is this something I need an RPC library for?

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Layout/PartialView access inconsistency" (#6966) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
In views:

Layout requires .cshtml extension:
`Layout = "/Views/Shared/_Layout.cshtml";`

But partial views don't:
`@await Html.PartialAsync("Foo/_BarPartial")`

I would expect this to be consistent.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Razor Pages Error with Section and TagHelpers " (#6964) at aspnet/Mvc
Closed issue "Url.Page() can not use path-based route if a custom route has been added" (#6957) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
After adding a custom route to my Index page, I am no longer able to generate URLs using the default path-based routes in Razor Pages.

Here is my custom route that allows me to add paging to the Index page, ie: `http://localhost:5000/page/2`

```
.AddRazorPagesOptions(options =>
{
    options.Conventions.AddPageRoute("/Index", "page/{pageNum}");
});
```

After adding that route, the following now returns null:
`Url.Page("/Index");`

Also, the following now throws *InvalidOperationException: No page named '/Index' matches the supplied values.*
`RedirectToPage("/Index");`

From what I can tell, this is the default behavior, based on the XML Documentation on the AddPageRoute method:
>The page can be routed via route in addition to the default set of path based routes. **All links generated for this page will use the specified route.**

Am I missing something, or is there no way to use the default path-based route after I start adding additional routes for a page?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Suggestion: Support migrating to new Password Hashers over time" (#1466) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Over time, password hashes that were once considered secure are no longer considered so. Therefore, it would be desirable to be able to support multiple hashes in a single identity database, and transparently re-encrypt users' passwords as they login if a more secure hash function is available.

A newer hash function may mean a new algorithm (e.g. Argon2), or simply more iterations / different configuration parameters for the algorithm already in use.

A possible implementation would be:

1.  ASPNet the identity `UserManager` has a `PasswordHashers` property added, which is a list of `IPasswordHasher` objects in order of ascending secure-ness called `PasswordHashers`. The existing `PasswordHasher` property is changed to retrieve the last item in the list, and is made read-only, so that newly stored passwords use the latest hash function.

2. The  list index of the `PasswordHasher` that was used for a particular user is stored in a property of the `TUser` object called `PasswordHashVersion` 

3. During the authentication process, if the password check is successful, but the `PasswordHashVersion` value indicates it was not hashed using the current hasher, re-hash the password using the current `UserManager.PasswordHasher` and update the hash and version stored in the `TUser` object.

This would mean, over time, users still using the application would have their password encryption level upgraded and it would not be stuck at the quality of hashing algorithm available in the year they signed up. Users who no longer user the application would be stuck with the older password hashes. However, administrators could query the database to report on the number of users with legacy hashes, and contact them to request they sign-in to retain their account.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Best practice to integrate Identity into a multiple-layers project?" (#1465) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I have google/bing this but no good solution/suggestion found, as all examples just demonstrate the usage in one project, I'm wondering what's the best practice for integrate Identity with a real solution like below.

- UI Layer (MVC)
- Domain/Models Layer (i.e. `AppUser`, and we may want to keep this layer POCOs)
- Infrastructures Layers (i.e. `AppDbContext`)

In this case, we cannot define an `AppDbContext : IdentityDbContext<AppUser>` because` AppUser` is expected an `IdentityUser`, to make this work, we have to add reference to Identity stuffs to Domain layer.

I understand that if I re-implement all Identity Stores inside the Infrastructures layer, this would work, but this sounds not so good.

Is there a best practice that we can reuse majority of Identity and keep each layer clean?

It's very appreciated to hear your suggestion?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "IEmailSender should have explicitly named parameters for html vs plain text" (#868) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
There have been a number of people reporting bugs about the email confirmation link in the StarterWeb template not working.

This is happening because people implement IEmailSender and don't realize that the message being passed in is html. When they send the email as plain text the confirmation link does not work because of the url encoding.

I think the "message" parameter of SendEmailAsync should be renamed to htmlMessage and possibly should have an additional parameter for "plainTextMessage" and both should be passed in from AccountController.

This would make it more clear to implementors of IEmailSender what kind of string(s) they are dealing with and how to correctly implement it.

related issues:
https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2152
https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2217
